00054   template<class T, class ConverterGenerator>
00055   void push_aux(lua_State* interpreter, T& value, ConverterGenerator*)
00056   {
00057       typedef typename boost::mpl::if_<
00058           boost::is_reference_wrapper<T>
00059         , BOOST_DEDUCED_TYPENAME boost::unwrap_reference<T>::type&
00060         , T
00061       >::type unwrapped_type;
00062 
00063       typename mpl::apply_wrap2<
00064           ConverterGenerator,unwrapped_type,cpp_to_lua
00065       >::type cv;
00066 
00067       cv.apply(
00068           interpreter
00069         , boost::implicit_cast<
00070               BOOST_DEDUCED_TYPENAME boost::unwrap_reference<T>::type&
00071           >(value)
00072       );
00073   }
00074 
00075   template<class T, class Policies>
00076   void push(lua_State* interpreter, T& value, Policies const&)
00077   {
00078       typedef typename find_conversion_policy<
00079           0
00080         , Policies
00081       >::type converter_policy;
00082 
00083       push_aux(interpreter, value, (converter_policy*)0);
00084   }
00085 
00086   template<class T>
00087   void push(lua_State* interpreter, T& value)
00088   {
00089       push(interpreter, value, null_type());
00090   }

00101   namespace is_object_interface_aux
00102   {
00103     typedef char (&yes)[1];
00104     typedef char (&no)[2];
00105     
00106     template <class T>
00107     yes check(object_interface<T>*);
00108     no check(void*);
00109 
00110     template <class T>
00111     struct impl 
00112     {
00113         BOOST_STATIC_CONSTANT(bool, value =
00114             sizeof(is_object_interface_aux::check((T*)0)) == sizeof(yes)
00115         );
00116 
00117         typedef mpl::bool_<value> type;
00118     };
00119 
00120   } // namespace detail

00122   template <class T>
00123   struct is_object_interface
00124     : is_object_interface_aux::impl<T>::type
00125   {};

00127   template <class R, class T, class U>
00128   struct enable_binary
00129 # ifndef BOOST_NO_SFINAE
00130     : boost::enable_if<
00131           mpl::or_<
00132               is_object_interface<T>
00133             , is_object_interface<U>
00134           >
00135         , R
00136       >
00137   {};
00138 # else
00139   {
00140       typedef R type;
00141   };
00142 # endif

00144   template<class T, class U>
00145   int binary_interpreter(lua_State*& L, T const& lhs, U const& rhs
00146     , boost::mpl::true_, boost::mpl::true_)
00147   {
00148        L = value_wrapper_traits<T>::interpreter(lhs);
00149                  lua_State* L2 = value_wrapper_traits<U>::interpreter(rhs);
00150 
00151        // you are comparing objects with different interpreters
00152        // that's not allowed.
00153                  assert(L == L2 || L == 0 || L2 == 0);
00154 
00155        // if the two objects we compare have different interpreters
00156        // then they
00157 
00158        if (L != L2) return -1;
00159        if (L == 0) return 1;
00160        return 0;
00161   }
00162         
00163   template<class T, class U>
00164   int binary_interpreter(lua_State*& L, T const& x, U const&
00165     , boost::mpl::true_, boost::mpl::false_)
00166   {
00167        L = value_wrapper_traits<T>::interpreter(x);
00168        return 0;
00169   }
00170 
00171   template<class T, class U>
00172   int binary_interpreter(lua_State*& L, T const&, U const& x, boost::mpl::false_, boost::mpl::true_)
00173   {
00174       L = value_wrapper_traits<U>::interpreter(x);
00175       return 0;
00176   }
00177 
00178   template<class T, class U>
00179   int binary_interpreter(lua_State*& L, T const& x, U const& y)
00180   {
00181       return binary_interpreter(
00182           L
00183         , x
00184         , y
00185         , is_value_wrapper<T>()
00186         , is_value_wrapper<U>()
00187       );
00188   }
00189 
00190 #define LUABIND_BINARY_OP_DEF(op, fn) \
00191   template<class LHS, class RHS> \
00192   typename enable_binary<bool,LHS,RHS>::type \
00193   operator op(LHS const& lhs, RHS const& rhs) \
00194   { \
00195       lua_State* L = 0; \
00196       switch (binary_interpreter(L, lhs, rhs)) \
00197       { \
00198           case 1: \
00199               return true; \
00200           case -1: \
00201               return false; \
00202       } \
00203 \
00204       assert(L); \
00205 \
00206       detail::stack_pop pop1(L, 1); \
00207       detail::push(L, lhs); \
00208       detail::stack_pop pop2(L, 1); \
00209       detail::push(L, rhs); \
00210 \
00211       return fn(L, -1, -2) != 0; \
00212   }
00213 
00214 LUABIND_BINARY_OP_DEF(==, lua_equal)
00215 LUABIND_BINARY_OP_DEF(<, lua_lessthan)

00217   template<class ValueWrapper>
00218   std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os
00219     , object_interface<ValueWrapper> const& v)
00220   {
00221       using namespace luabind;
00222       lua_State* interpreter = value_wrapper_traits<ValueWrapper>::interpreter(
00223           static_cast<ValueWrapper const&>(v));
00224       detail::stack_pop pop(interpreter, 1);
00225       value_wrapper_traits<ValueWrapper>::unwrap(interpreter
00226         , static_cast<ValueWrapper const&>(v));
00227                 char const* p = lua_tostring(interpreter, -1);
00228         std::size_t len = lua_strlen(interpreter, -1);
00229                 std::copy(p, p + len, std::ostream_iterator<char>(os));
00230                 return os;
00231         }
00232 
00233 #undef LUABIND_BINARY_OP_DEF
00234 
00235   template<class LHS, class RHS>
00236   typename enable_binary<bool,LHS,RHS>::type
00237   operator>(LHS const& lhs, RHS const& rhs)
00238   {
00239       return !(lhs < rhs || lhs == rhs);
00240   }
00241 
00242   template<class LHS, class RHS>
00243   typename enable_binary<bool,LHS,RHS>::type 
00244   operator<=(LHS const& lhs, RHS const& rhs)
00245   {
00246       return lhs < rhs || lhs == rhs;
00247   }
00248 
00249   template<class LHS, class RHS>
00250   typename enable_binary<bool,LHS,RHS>::type 
00251   operator>=(LHS const& lhs, RHS const& rhs)
00252   {
00253       return !(lhs < rhs);
00254   }
00255 
00256   template<class LHS, class RHS>
00257   typename enable_binary<bool,LHS,RHS>::type 
00258   operator!=(LHS const& lhs, RHS const& rhs)
00259   {
00260       return !(lhs == rhs);
00261   }

00271   template<class Derived>
00272   class object_interface
00273   {
00274       struct safe_bool_type {};
00275   public:
00276       ~object_interface() {}
00277 
00278       call_proxy<Derived, boost::tuples::tuple<> > operator()();
00279 
00280       template<class A0>
00281       call_proxy<
00282           Derived
00283         , boost::tuples::tuple<A0 const*>
00284       > operator()(A0 const& a0)
00285       {
00286           typedef boost::tuples::tuple<A0 const*> arguments;
00287 
00288           return call_proxy<Derived, arguments>(
00289               derived()
00290             , arguments(&a0)
00291           );
00292       }
00293 
00294       template<class A0, class A1>
00295       call_proxy<
00296           Derived
00297         , boost::tuples::tuple<A0 const*, A1 const*>
00298       > operator()(A0 const& a0, A1 const& a1)
00299       {
00300           typedef boost::tuples::tuple<A0 const*, A1 const*> arguments;
00301 
00302           return call_proxy<Derived, arguments>(
00303               derived()
00304             , arguments(&a0, &a1)
00305           );
00306       }
00307 
00308       // The rest of the overloads are PP-generated.
00309       #define BOOST_PP_ITERATION_PARAMS_1 (3, \
00310           (3, LUABIND_MAX_ARITY, <luabind/detail/object_call.hpp>))
00311       #include BOOST_PP_ITERATE()
00312 
00313       operator safe_bool_type*() const
00314       {
00315           lua_State* L = value_wrapper_traits<Derived>::interpreter(derived());
00316 
00317           if (!L)
00318               return 0;
00319 
00320           value_wrapper_traits<Derived>::unwrap(L, derived());
00321           detail::stack_pop pop(L, 1);
00322 
00323           return lua_toboolean(L, -1) == 1 ? (safe_bool_type*)1 : 0;
00324       }
00325 
00326   private:
00327       Derived& derived()
00328       {
00329           return *static_cast<Derived*>(this);
00330       }
00331 
00332       Derived const& derived() const
00333       {
00334           return *static_cast<Derived const*>(this);
00335       }
00336   };

00338 #ifdef LUABIND_USE_VALUE_WRAPPER_TAG
00339   struct iterator_proxy_tag;

00342   template<class AccessPolicy>
00343   class iterator_proxy
00344     : public object_interface<iterator_proxy<AccessPolicy> >
00345   {
00346   public:
00347 #ifdef LUABIND_USE_VALUE_WRAPPER_TAG
00348       typedef iterator_proxy_tag value_wrapper_tag;
00349 #endif
00350 
00351       iterator_proxy(lua_State* interpreter, handle const& table, handle const& key)
00352         : m_interpreter(interpreter)
00353         , m_table_index(lua_gettop(interpreter) + 1)
00354         , m_key_index(m_table_index + 1)
00355       {
00356           table.push(m_interpreter);
00357           key.push(m_interpreter);
00358       }
00359 
00360       iterator_proxy(iterator_proxy const& other)
00361         : m_interpreter(other.m_interpreter)
00362         , m_table_index(other.m_table_index)
00363         , m_key_index(other.m_key_index)
00364       {
00365           other.m_interpreter = 0;
00366       }
00367 
00368       ~iterator_proxy()
00369       {
00370           if (m_interpreter)
00371               lua_pop(m_interpreter, 2);
00372       }
00373 
00374                 // this will set the value to nil
00375                 iterator_proxy & operator=(luabind::detail::nil_type)
00376                 {
00377           lua_pushvalue(m_interpreter, m_key_index);
00378                          lua_pushnil(m_interpreter);
00379           AccessPolicy::set(m_interpreter, m_table_index);
00380           return *this;
00381                 }
00382 
00383       template<class T>
00384       iterator_proxy& operator=(T const& value)
00385       {
00386           lua_pushvalue(m_interpreter, m_key_index);
00387           detail::push(m_interpreter, value);
00388           AccessPolicy::set(m_interpreter, m_table_index);
00389           return *this;
00390       }
00391 
00392       template<class Key>
00393       index_proxy<iterator_proxy<AccessPolicy> > operator[](Key const& key)
00394       {
00395           return index_proxy<iterator_proxy<AccessPolicy> >(
00396               *this, m_interpreter, key
00397           );
00398       }
00399 
00400       // This is non-const to prevent conversion on lvalues.
00401       operator object();
00402 
00403       lua_State* interpreter() const
00404       {
00405           return m_interpreter;
00406       }
00407 
00408       // TODO: Why is it non-const?
00409       void push(lua_State* interpreter)
00410       {
00411           assert(interpreter == m_interpreter);
00412           lua_pushvalue(m_interpreter, m_key_index);
00413           AccessPolicy::get(m_interpreter, m_table_index);
00414       }
00415 
00416   private:
00417       mutable lua_State* m_interpreter;
00418       int m_table_index;
00419       int m_key_index;
00420   };

00424 namespace detail

00426   struct basic_access
00427   {
00428       static void set(lua_State* interpreter, int table)
00429       {
00430           lua_settable(interpreter, table);
00431       }
00432 
00433       static void get(lua_State* interpreter, int table)
00434       {
00435           lua_gettable(interpreter, table);
00436       }
00437   };
00438 
00439   struct raw_access
00440   {
00441       static void set(lua_State* interpreter, int table)
00442       {
00443           lua_rawset(interpreter, table);
00444       }
00445 
00446       static void get(lua_State* interpreter, int table)
00447       {
00448           lua_rawget(interpreter, table);
00449       }
00450   };

00452   template<class AccessPolicy>
00453   class basic_iterator 
00454     : public boost::iterator_facade<
00455         basic_iterator<AccessPolicy>
00456       , adl::iterator_proxy<AccessPolicy>
00457       , boost::single_pass_traversal_tag
00458       , adl::iterator_proxy<AccessPolicy>
00459     >
00460   {
00461   public:
00462       basic_iterator()
00463         : m_interpreter(0)
00464       {}
00465 
00466       template<class ValueWrapper>
00467       explicit basic_iterator(ValueWrapper const& value_wrapper)
00468         : m_interpreter(
00469               value_wrapper_traits<ValueWrapper>::interpreter(value_wrapper)
00470           )
00471       {
00472           detail::stack_pop pop(m_interpreter, 1);
00473           value_wrapper_traits<ValueWrapper>::unwrap(m_interpreter, value_wrapper);
00474 
00475           lua_pushnil(m_interpreter);
00476           if (lua_next(m_interpreter, -2) != 0)
00477           {
00478               detail::stack_pop pop(m_interpreter, 2);
00479               handle(m_interpreter, -2).swap(m_key);
00480           }
00481           else
00482           {
00483               m_interpreter = 0;
00484               return;
00485           }
00486 
00487           handle(m_interpreter, -1).swap(m_table);
00488       }
00489 
00490       adl::object key() const;
00491 
00492   private:
00493       friend class boost::iterator_core_access;
00494 
00495       void increment()
00496       {
00497           m_table.push(m_interpreter);
00498           m_key.push(m_interpreter);
00499 
00500           detail::stack_pop pop(m_interpreter, 1);
00501 
00502           if (lua_next(m_interpreter, -2) != 0)
00503           {
00504               m_key.replace(m_interpreter, -2);
00505               lua_pop(m_interpreter, 2);
00506           }
00507           else
00508           {
00509               m_interpreter = 0;
00510               handle().swap(m_table);
00511               handle().swap(m_key);
00512           }
00513       }
00514 
00515       bool equal(basic_iterator const& other) const
00516       {
00517           if (m_interpreter == 0 && other.m_interpreter == 0)
00518               return true;
00519 
00520           if (m_interpreter != other.m_interpreter)
00521               return false;
00522 
00523           detail::stack_pop pop(m_interpreter, 2);
00524           m_key.push(m_interpreter);
00525           other.m_key.push(m_interpreter);
00526           return lua_equal(m_interpreter, -2, -1) != 0;
00527       }
00528 
00529       adl::iterator_proxy<AccessPolicy> dereference() const 
00530       {
00531           return adl::iterator_proxy<AccessPolicy>(m_interpreter, m_table, m_key);
00532       }
00533 
00534       lua_State* m_interpreter;
00535       handle m_table;
00536       handle m_key;
00537   };

00541 #define LUABIND_OPERATOR_ADL_WKND(op) \
00542   inline bool operator op( \
00543       basic_iterator<basic_access> const& x \
00544     , basic_iterator<basic_access> const& y) \
00545   { \
00546       return boost::operator op(x, y); \
00547   } \
00548  \
00549   inline bool operator op( \
00550       basic_iterator<raw_access> const& x \
00551     , basic_iterator<raw_access> const& y) \
00552   { \
00553       return boost::operator op(x, y); \
00554   }

00557   LUABIND_OPERATOR_ADL_WKND(!=)

00559 #undef LUABIND_OPERATOR_ADL_WKND

00570   template<class Next>
00571   class index_proxy
00572     : public object_interface<index_proxy<Next> >
00573   {
00574   public:
00575 #ifdef LUABIND_USE_VALUE_WRAPPER_TAG
00576       typedef index_proxy_tag value_wrapper_tag;
00577 #endif
00578 
00579       typedef index_proxy<Next> this_type;
00580 
00581       template<class Key>
00582       index_proxy(Next const& next, lua_State* interpreter, Key const& key)
00583         : m_interpreter(interpreter)
00584         , m_key_index(lua_gettop(interpreter) + 1)
00585         , m_next(next)
00586       {
00587           detail::push(m_interpreter, key);
00588       }
00589 
00590       index_proxy(index_proxy const& other)
00591         : m_interpreter(other.m_interpreter)
00592         , m_key_index(other.m_key_index)
00593         , m_next(other.m_next)
00594       {
00595           other.m_interpreter = 0;
00596       }
00597 
00598       ~index_proxy()
00599       {
00600           if (m_interpreter)
00601               lua_pop(m_interpreter, 1);
00602       }
00603 
00604       // This is non-const to prevent conversion on lvalues.
00605       operator object();
00606 
00607                 // this will set the value to nil
00608                 this_type& operator=(luabind::detail::nil_type)
00609                 {
00610                value_wrapper_traits<Next>::unwrap(m_interpreter, m_next);
00611           detail::stack_pop pop(m_interpreter, 1);
00612 
00613           lua_pushvalue(m_interpreter, m_key_index);
00614                          lua_pushnil(m_interpreter);
00615           lua_settable(m_interpreter, -3);
00616           return *this;
00617                 }
00618                 
00619       template<class T>
00620       this_type& operator=(T const& value)
00621       {
00622           value_wrapper_traits<Next>::unwrap(m_interpreter, m_next);
00623           detail::stack_pop pop(m_interpreter, 1);
00624 
00625           lua_pushvalue(m_interpreter, m_key_index);
00626           detail::push(m_interpreter, value);
00627           lua_settable(m_interpreter, -3);
00628           return *this;
00629       }
00630 
00631       this_type& operator=(this_type const& value)
00632       {
00633           value_wrapper_traits<Next>::unwrap(m_interpreter, m_next);
00634           detail::stack_pop pop(m_interpreter, 1);
00635 
00636           lua_pushvalue(m_interpreter, m_key_index);
00637           detail::push(m_interpreter, value);
00638           lua_settable(m_interpreter, -3);
00639           return *this;
00640       }
00641 
00642       template<class T>
00643       index_proxy<this_type> operator[](T const& key)
00644       {
00645           return index_proxy<this_type>(*this, m_interpreter, key);
00646       }
00647 
00648       void push(lua_State* interpreter);
00649 
00650       lua_State* interpreter() const
00651       {
00652           return m_interpreter;
00653       }
00654 
00655   private:
00656                 struct hidden_type {};
00657                 
00658 //      this_type& operator=(index_proxy<Next> const&);
00659 
00660       mutable lua_State* m_interpreter;
00661       int m_key_index;
00662 
00663       Next const& m_next;
00664   };

00668 typedef detail::basic_iterator<detail::basic_access> iterator;
00669 typedef detail::basic_iterator<detail::raw_access> raw_iterator;

00671 #ifndef LUABIND_USE_VALUE_WRAPPER_TAG
00672 template<class T>
00673 struct value_wrapper_traits<adl::index_proxy<T> >
00674 #else
00675 template<>
00676 struct value_wrapper_traits<adl::index_proxy_tag>
00677 #endif
00678 {
00679     typedef boost::mpl::true_ is_specialized;
00680 
00681     template<class Next>
00682     static lua_State* interpreter(adl::index_proxy<Next> const& proxy)
00683     {
00684         return proxy.interpreter();
00685     }
00686 
00687     template<class Next>
00688     static void unwrap(lua_State* interpreter, adl::index_proxy<Next> const& proxy)
00689     {
00690         const_cast<adl::index_proxy<Next>&>(proxy).push(interpreter);
00691     }
00692 };

00694 #ifndef LUABIND_USE_VALUE_WRAPPER_TAG
00695 template<class AccessPolicy>
00696 struct value_wrapper_traits<adl::iterator_proxy<AccessPolicy> >
00697 #else
00698 template<>
00699 struct value_wrapper_traits<adl::iterator_proxy_tag>
00700 #endif
00701 {
00702     typedef boost::mpl::true_ is_specialized;
00703 
00704     template<class Proxy>
00705     static lua_State* interpreter(Proxy const& p)
00706     {
00707         return p.interpreter();
00708     }
00709 
00710     template<class Proxy>
00711     static void unwrap(lua_State* interpreter, Proxy const& p)
00712     {
00713         // TODO: Why const_cast?
00714         const_cast<Proxy&>(p).push(interpreter);
00715     }
00716 };
00717 
00718 namespace adl
00719 {
00720 
00721   // An object holds a reference to a Lua value residing
00722   // in the registry.
00723   class object : public object_interface<object>
00724   {
00725   public:
00726       object()
00727       {}
00728 
00729       explicit object(handle const& other)
00730         : m_handle(other)
00731       {}
00732 
00733       explicit object(from_stack const& stack_reference)
00734         : m_handle(stack_reference.interpreter, stack_reference.index)
00735       {
00736       }
00737 
00738       template<class T>
00739       object(lua_State* interpreter, T const& value)
00740       {
00741           detail::push(interpreter, value);
00742           detail::stack_pop pop(interpreter, 1);
00743           handle(interpreter, -1).swap(m_handle);
00744       }
00745 
00746       template<class T, class Policies>
00747       object(lua_State* interpreter, T const& value, Policies const&)
00748       {
00749           detail::push(interpreter, value, Policies());
00750           detail::stack_pop pop(interpreter, 1);
00751           handle(interpreter, -1).swap(m_handle);
00752       }
00753 
00754       void push(lua_State* interpreter) const;
00755       lua_State* interpreter() const;
00756       bool is_valid() const;
00757 
00758       template<class T>
00759       index_proxy<object> operator[](T const& key) const
00760       {
00761           return index_proxy<object>(
00762               *this, m_handle.interpreter(), key
00763           );
00764       }
00765 
00766       void swap(object& other)
00767       {
00768           m_handle.swap(other.m_handle);
00769       }
00770 
00771   private:
00772       handle m_handle;
00773   };
00774 
00775   inline void object::push(lua_State* interpreter) const
00776   {
00777       m_handle.push(interpreter);
00778   }
00779 
00780   inline lua_State* object::interpreter() const
00781   {
00782       return m_handle.interpreter();
00783   }
00784 
00785   inline bool object::is_valid() const
00786   {
00787       return m_handle.interpreter() != 0;
00788   }
00789 
00790   class argument : public object_interface<argument>
00791   {
00792   public:
00793           argument(from_stack const& stack_reference)
00794                 : m_interpreter(stack_reference.interpreter)
00795                 , m_index(stack_reference.index)
00796           {
00797                   if (m_index < 0)
00798                           m_index = lua_gettop(m_interpreter) - m_index + 1;
00799           }
00800 
00801       template<class T>
00802       index_proxy<argument> operator[](T const& key) const
00803       {
00804           return index_proxy<argument>(*this, m_interpreter, key);
00805       }
00806 
00807           void push(lua_State* L) const
00808           {
00809                   lua_pushvalue(L, m_index);
00810           }
00811 
00812           lua_State* interpreter() const
00813           {
00814                   return m_interpreter;
00815           }
00816 
00817   private:
00818           lua_State* m_interpreter;
00819           int m_index;
00820   };
00821 
00822 } // namespace adl
00823 
00824 using adl::object;
00825 using adl::argument;

00827 #ifndef LUABIND_USE_VALUE_WRAPPER_TAG
00828 template <class ValueWrapper, class Arguments>
00829 struct value_wrapper_traits<adl::call_proxy<ValueWrapper, Arguments> >
00830 #else
00831 template<>
00832 struct value_wrapper_traits<adl::call_proxy_tag>
00833 #endif
00834 {
00835     typedef boost::mpl::true_ is_specialized;
00836 
00837     template<class W, class A>
00838     static lua_State* interpreter(adl::call_proxy<W,A> const& proxy)
00839     {
00840         return value_wrapper_traits<W>::interpreter(*proxy.value_wrapper);
00841     }
00842 
00843     template<class W, class A>
00844     static void unwrap(lua_State*, adl::call_proxy<W,A> const& proxy)
00845     {
00846         object result = const_cast<adl::call_proxy<W,A>&>(proxy);
00847         result.push(result.interpreter());
00848     }
00849 };
00850 
00851 template<>
00852 struct value_wrapper_traits<object>
00853 {
00854     typedef boost::mpl::true_ is_specialized;
00855 
00856     static lua_State* interpreter(object const& value)
00857     {
00858         return value.interpreter();
00859     }
00860 
00861     static void unwrap(lua_State* interpreter, object const& value)
00862     {
00863         value.push(interpreter);
00864     }
00865 
00866     static bool check(...)
00867     {
00868         return true;
00869     }
00870 };
00871 
00872 template<>
00873 struct value_wrapper_traits<argument>
00874 {
00875     typedef boost::mpl::true_ is_specialized;
00876 
00877     static lua_State* interpreter(argument const& value)
00878     {
00879         return value.interpreter();
00880     }
00881 
00882     static void unwrap(lua_State* interpreter, argument const& value)
00883     {
00884         value.push(interpreter);
00885     }
00886 
00887     static bool check(...)
00888     {
00889         return true;
00890     }
00891 };
00892 
00893 template<class Next>
00894 inline void adl::index_proxy<Next>::push(lua_State* interpreter)
00895 {
00896     assert(interpreter == m_interpreter);
00897 
00898     value_wrapper_traits<Next>::unwrap(m_interpreter, m_next);
00899 
00900     lua_pushvalue(m_interpreter, m_key_index);
00901     lua_gettable(m_interpreter, -2);
00902     lua_remove(m_interpreter, -2);
00903 }
00904 
00905 template<class Next>
00906 inline adl::index_proxy<Next>::operator object()
00907 {
00908     detail::stack_pop pop(m_interpreter, 1);
00909     push(m_interpreter);
00910     return object(from_stack(m_interpreter, -1));
00911 }
00912 
00913 template<class AccessPolicy>
00914 adl::iterator_proxy<AccessPolicy>::operator object()
00915 {
00916     lua_pushvalue(m_interpreter, m_key_index);
00917     AccessPolicy::get(m_interpreter, m_table_index);
00918     detail::stack_pop pop(m_interpreter, 1);
00919     return object(from_stack(m_interpreter, -1));
00920 }
00921 
00922 template<class AccessPolicy>
00923 object detail::basic_iterator<AccessPolicy>::key() const
00924 {
00925     return object(m_key);
00926 }

00928 namespace detail 
00929 {
00930 
00931   template<
00932       class T
00933     , class ValueWrapper
00934     , class Policies
00935     , class ErrorPolicy
00936     , class ReturnType
00937   >
00938   ReturnType object_cast_aux(
00939       ValueWrapper const& value_wrapper
00940     , T*
00941     , Policies*
00942     , ErrorPolicy*
00943     , ReturnType*
00944   )
00945   {
00946       lua_State* interpreter = value_wrapper_traits<ValueWrapper>::interpreter(
00947           value_wrapper
00948       );
00949 
00950 #ifndef LUABIND_NO_ERROR_CHECKING
00951       if (!interpreter) 
00952           return ErrorPolicy::handle_error(interpreter, typeid(void));
00953 #endif
00954 
00955       value_wrapper_traits<ValueWrapper>::unwrap(interpreter, value_wrapper);
00956 
00957       detail::stack_pop pop(interpreter, 1);
00958 
00959       typedef typename detail::find_conversion_policy<
00960           0
00961         , Policies
00962       >::type converter_generator;
00963 
00964       typename mpl::apply_wrap2<converter_generator, T, lua_to_cpp>::type cv;
00965 
00966 #ifndef LUABIND_NO_ERROR_CHECKING
00967       if (cv.match(interpreter, LUABIND_DECORATE_TYPE(T), -1) < 0)
00968       {
00969           return ErrorPolicy::handle_error(interpreter, typeid(T));
00970       }
00971 #endif
00972 
00973       return cv.apply(interpreter, LUABIND_DECORATE_TYPE(T), -1);
00974   }
00975 
00976 # ifdef BOOST_MSVC
00977 #  pragma warning(push)
00978 #  pragma warning(disable:4702) // unreachable code
00979 # endif
00980 
00981   template<class T>
00982   struct throw_error_policy
00983   {
00984       static T handle_error(lua_State* interpreter, type_id const& type_info)
00985       {
00986 #ifndef LUABIND_NO_EXCEPTIONS
00987           throw cast_failed(interpreter, type_info);
00988 #else
00989           cast_failed_callback_fun e = get_cast_failed_callback();
00990           if (e) e(interpreter, type_info);
00991 
00992           assert(0 && "object_cast failed. If you want to handle this error use "
00993               "luabind::set_error_callback()");
00994           std::terminate();
00995 #endif
00996           return *(typename boost::remove_reference<T>::type*)0;
00997       }
00998   };
00999 
01000 # ifdef BOOST_MSVC
01001 #  pragma warning(pop)
01002 # endif
01003 
01004   template<class T>
01005   struct nothrow_error_policy
01006   {
01007       static boost::optional<T> handle_error(lua_State*, type_id const&)
01008       {
01009           return boost::optional<T>();
01010       }
01011   };
01012 
01013 } // namespace detail
01014 
01015 template<class T, class ValueWrapper>
01016 T object_cast(ValueWrapper const& value_wrapper)
01017 {
01018     return detail::object_cast_aux(
01019         value_wrapper
01020       , (T*)0
01021       , (detail::null_type*)0
01022       , (detail::throw_error_policy<T>*)0
01023       , (T*)0
01024     );
01025 }
01026 
01027 template<class T, class ValueWrapper, class Policies>
01028 T object_cast(ValueWrapper const& value_wrapper, Policies const&)
01029 {
01030     return detail::object_cast_aux(
01031         value_wrapper
01032       , (T*)0
01033       , (Policies*)0
01034       , (detail::throw_error_policy<T>*)0
01035       , (T*)0
01036     );
01037 }
01038 
01039 template<class T, class ValueWrapper>
01040 boost::optional<T> object_cast_nothrow(ValueWrapper const& value_wrapper)
01041 {
01042     return detail::object_cast_aux(
01043         value_wrapper
01044       , (T*)0
01045       , (detail::null_type*)0
01046       , (detail::nothrow_error_policy<T>*)0
01047       , (boost::optional<T>*)0
01048     );
01049 }
01050 
01051 template<class T, class ValueWrapper, class Policies>
01052 boost::optional<T> object_cast_nothrow(ValueWrapper const& value_wrapper, Policies const&)
01053 {
01054     return detail::object_cast_aux(
01055         value_wrapper
01056       , (T*)0
01057       , (Policies*)0
01058       , (detail::nothrow_error_policy<T>*)0
01059       , (boost::optional<T>*)0
01060     );
01061 }

01063 namespace detail
01064 {
01065 
01066   template<int Index>
01067   struct push_args_from_tuple
01068   {
01069       template<class H, class T, class Policies>
01070       inline static void apply(lua_State* L, const boost::tuples::cons<H, T>& x, const Policies& p) 
01071       {
01072           convert_to_lua_p<Index>(L, *x.get_head(), p);
01073           push_args_from_tuple<Index+1>::apply(L, x.get_tail(), p);
01074       }
01075 
01076       template<class H, class T>
01077       inline static void apply(lua_State* L, const boost::tuples::cons<H, T>& x) 
01078       {
01079           convert_to_lua(L, *x.get_head());
01080           push_args_from_tuple<Index+1>::apply(L, x.get_tail());
01081       }
01082 
01083       template<class Policies>
01084       inline static void apply(lua_State*, const boost::tuples::null_type&, const Policies&) {}
01085 
01086       inline static void apply(lua_State*, const boost::tuples::null_type&) {}
01087   };
01088 
01089 } // namespace detail
01090 
01091 namespace adl
01092 {
01093 
01094   template<class ValueWrapper, class Arguments>
01095   struct call_proxy
01096   {
01097       call_proxy(ValueWrapper& value_wrapper, Arguments arguments)
01098         : value_wrapper(&value_wrapper)
01099         , arguments(arguments)
01100       {}
01101 
01102       call_proxy(call_proxy const& other)
01103         : value_wrapper(other.value_wrapper)
01104         , arguments(other.arguments)
01105       {
01106           other.value_wrapper = 0;
01107       }
01108 
01109       ~call_proxy()
01110       {
01111           if (value_wrapper)
01112               call((detail::null_type*)0);
01113       }
01114 
01115       operator object()
01116       {
01117           return call((detail::null_type*)0);
01118       }
01119 
01120       template<class Policies>
01121       object operator[](Policies const&)
01122       {
01123           return call((Policies*)0);
01124       }
01125 
01126       template<class Policies>
01127       object call(Policies*)
01128       {
01129           lua_State* interpreter = value_wrapper_traits<ValueWrapper>::interpreter(
01130               *value_wrapper
01131           );
01132 
01133           value_wrapper_traits<ValueWrapper>::unwrap(
01134               interpreter
01135             , *value_wrapper
01136           );
01137 
01138           value_wrapper = 0;
01139 
01140           detail::push_args_from_tuple<1>::apply(interpreter, arguments, Policies());
01141 
01142           if (detail::pcall(interpreter, boost::tuples::length<Arguments>::value, 1))
01143           {
01144 #ifndef LUABIND_NO_EXCEPTIONS
01145               throw luabind::error(interpreter);
01146 #else
01147               error_callback_fun e = get_error_callback();
01148               if (e) e(interpreter);
01149 
01150               assert(0 && "the lua function threw an error and exceptions are disabled."
01151                   "if you want to handle this error use luabind::set_error_callback()");
01152               std::terminate();
01153 #endif
01154           }
01155 
01156           detail::stack_pop pop(interpreter, 1);
01157           return object(from_stack(interpreter, -1));
01158       }
01159 
01160       mutable ValueWrapper* value_wrapper;
01161       Arguments arguments;
01162   };
01163 
01164   template<class Derived>
01165   call_proxy<Derived, boost::tuples::tuple<> >
01166   object_interface<Derived>::operator()()
01167   {
01168       return call_proxy<Derived, boost::tuples::tuple<> >(
01169           derived()
01170         , boost::tuples::tuple<>()
01171       );
01172   }
01173 
01174   // Simple value_wrapper adaptor with the sole purpose of helping with
01175   // overload resolution. Use this as a function parameter type instead
01176   // of "object" or "argument" to restrict the parameter to Lua tables.
01177   template <class Base = object>
01178   struct table : Base
01179   {
01180       table(from_stack const& stack_reference)
01181         : Base(stack_reference)
01182       {}
01183   };
01184 
01185 } // namespace adl
01186 
01187 using adl::table;
01188 
01189 template <class Base>
01190 struct value_wrapper_traits<adl::table<Base> >
01191   : value_wrapper_traits<Base>
01192 {
01193     static bool check(lua_State* L, int idx)
01194     {
01195         return value_wrapper_traits<Base>::check(L, idx) &&
01196             lua_istable(L, idx);
01197     }
01198 };
01199 
01200 inline object newtable(lua_State* interpreter)
01201 {
01202     lua_newtable(interpreter);
01203     detail::stack_pop pop(interpreter, 1);
01204     return object(from_stack(interpreter, -1));
01205 }

01208 inline object globals(lua_State* interpreter)
01209 {
01210     lua_pushvalue(interpreter, LUA_GLOBALSINDEX);
01211     detail::stack_pop pop(interpreter, 1);
01212     return object(from_stack(interpreter, -1));
01213 }

01215 // this could be optimized by returning a proxy
01216 inline object registry(lua_State* interpreter)
01217 {
01218     lua_pushvalue(interpreter, LUA_REGISTRYINDEX);
01219     detail::stack_pop pop(interpreter, 1);
01220     return object(from_stack(interpreter, -1));
01221 }

01223 template<class ValueWrapper, class K>
01224 inline object gettable(ValueWrapper const& table, K const& key)
01225 {
01226     lua_State* interpreter = value_wrapper_traits<ValueWrapper>::interpreter(
01227         table
01228     );
01229 
01230     value_wrapper_traits<ValueWrapper>::unwrap(interpreter, table);
01231     detail::stack_pop pop(interpreter, 2);
01232     detail::push(interpreter, key);
01233     lua_gettable(interpreter, -2);
01234     return object(from_stack(interpreter, -1));
01235 }

01237 template<class ValueWrapper, class K, class T>
01238 inline void settable(ValueWrapper const& table, K const& key, T const& value)
01239 {
01240     lua_State* interpreter = value_wrapper_traits<ValueWrapper>::interpreter(
01241         table
01242     );
01243 
01244     // TODO: Exception safe?
01245     
01246     value_wrapper_traits<ValueWrapper>::unwrap(interpreter, table);
01247     detail::stack_pop pop(interpreter, 1);
01248     detail::push(interpreter, key);
01249     detail::push(interpreter, value);
01250     lua_settable(interpreter, -3);
01251 }

01361     ValueWrapper1 const& function, int index, ValueWrapper2 const& value)
01362 {

01364         function
01365     );

01368     detail::stack_pop pop(interpreter, 1);

01370     lua_setupvalue(interpreter, -2, index);

01372 
01373 template <class GetValueWrapper>
01374 object property(GetValueWrapper const& get)
01375 {
01376     lua_State* interpreter = value_wrapper_traits<GetValueWrapper>::interpreter(
01377         get
01378     );
01379 
01380     value_wrapper_traits<GetValueWrapper>::unwrap(interpreter, get);
01381     lua_pushnil(interpreter);
01382 
01383     lua_pushcclosure(interpreter, &detail::property_tag, 2);
01384     detail::stack_pop pop(interpreter, 1);
01385 
01386     return object(from_stack(interpreter, -1));
01387 }
01388 
01389 template <class GetValueWrapper, class SetValueWrapper>
01390 object property(GetValueWrapper const& get, SetValueWrapper const& set)
01391 {
01392     lua_State* interpreter = value_wrapper_traits<GetValueWrapper>::interpreter(
01393         get
01394     );
01395 
01396     value_wrapper_traits<GetValueWrapper>::unwrap(interpreter, get);
01397     value_wrapper_traits<SetValueWrapper>::unwrap(interpreter, set);
01398 
01399     lua_pushcclosure(interpreter, &detail::property_tag, 2);
01400     detail::stack_pop pop(interpreter, 1);
01401 
01402     return object(from_stack(interpreter, -1));
01403 
01404 }
